stadium.name: The Glowstone Terrace
stadium.description: A massive, opulent stadium built on one of the city's main terraces, carved directly into the mountainside. The field is famously paved with polished Glowstone, and the stands overlook the bustling Confluence Market and the ongoing construction of the Guild's Skyport.

stats.pregame_ritual: Doing a terrible, clumsy dance to 'loosen the joints'.
Chugging a raw egg, shell and all.
Wearing their boots on the wrong feet during the warm-up.
Arm-wrestling the player who plays the same position on their team.
Speaking only in rhymes for the hour before the game.
Rubbing the Trollball on their armpits for 'grip'.
Wearing their boots on the wrong feet during the warm-up.
Going over the game plan drawn in the dirt with the team captain.
Covering their forearms in a sticky tree sap for 'grip'.
Eating a dandelion, stem and all.
Headbutting their own team's goal post (gently).

Wearing their boots on the wrong feet during the warm-up.

stadium.name: The High-Pass Pitch
stadium.description: A field built at a breathtaking altitude in a fortified mountain pass. The air is painfully thin, and the weather is dangerously unpredictable.

stats.pregame_ritual: Tying a small, hand-carved wooden bird to their gear.
Slapping their own helmet until their ears ring.
Avoiding eye contact with anyone wearing the color green.
Sharing a ceremonial, non-alcoholic grog from a communal cup.
Whispering a secret fear to the Trollball before the game.
Reciting their grocery list backward to clear their mind.
Dipping their hands in a bucket of ice-cold well water.
Asking a teammate to tell them a story, but only the beginning.
Exchanging well-wishes with their direct opponent before the game starts.
Singing a sea shanty completely out of tune.
Getting a teammate to punch them in the shoulder, hard.
Whispering a secret fear to the Trollball before the game.
Reciting their grocery list backward to clear their mind.
Asking a teammate to tell them a story, but only the beginning.
Exchanging well-wishes with their direct opponent before the game starts.

Sharing a ceremonial, non-alcoholic grog from a communal cup.

preGame:
# üéôÔ∏è Live from the Glowstone Terrace! üéôÔ∏è

Hello everybody, I'm your host Nok the Corrupter, the demon with the mostest, coming to you live from the bustling heights of Confluence! The air is thick with the scent of mountain wind, market-day meat skewers, and the delicious, palpable fear of the Oread's Summit Tamers! We are in the Winners Bracket of the playoffs, folks! It is Game 1 of a Best of 3 series, and the atmosphere is more tense than a soul-contract negotiation! The Glowstone Terrace is shimmering so brightly it‚Äôll peel the retinas right out of your skull if you aren't careful, but that‚Äôs just part of the charm! 

Tonight, we‚Äôve got the home-town favorites, the Confluence Captains, looking to use that mountain-side advantage! I saw Ladew Evelina earlier chugging a raw egg‚Äîshell and all‚Äîand let me tell you, that is the kind of calcium-rich commitment I love to see! On the other side, the Tamers are looking a bit jittery. Alwyn Wandy was seen whispering secret fears to the Trollball. I hope that ball is a good listener, because it‚Äôs about to hear a lot more screaming once the hitting starts! Saloma Talich is already getting punched in the shoulder by his teammates to wake up, and honestly, if they don't hit him harder, the Captains certainly will! 

Our crowd today is massive! The popularity of the Captains is surging like a tidal wave of gold, while the Tamers are about as popular as a case of the Nether-Chills. I haven't seen this many people in one place since the last time Lord Orzalon decided to rearrange the furniture in the Demon Prison! Even the Guild of the Black Sky elites are out in force‚ÄîI think I see Brennen Farno up there, looking as pretty and un-kissed as a fresh tombstone! Let‚Äôs get to the action before the mountain wind blows my hat off!
postGame:
# üèÜ Captains Conquer the Terrace! 4-1 Victory! üèÜ

What a spectacular display of athletic carnage, sports fans! The Confluence Captains have defended their home turf with the kind of ruthless efficiency that would make the Butcher of Confluence, Cyfnerth himself, shed a single, bloody tear of joy! The Tamers came into this mountain pass looking for a win, but they‚Äôre leaving with nothing but bruises and a serious case of Glowstone-induced vertigo! The home crowd is absolutely losing their minds, and for good reason‚Äîthe Captains have taken a 1-0 lead in this Best of 3 series! 

The scoring started early and often, folks! Richia Pazit, showing off that incredible focus, launched a shot from Center Field that sailed through the uprights for a 2-point Shoot! Talk about a statement piece! It was a beautiful arc of leather that silenced the few Tamers fans brave enough to make the climb. The Captains didn't stop there, either. Behl Berstine connected with Deach Sharlene for a classic touchdown dunk, making the Tamers' defense look like they were still reciting their grocery lists backward!

But let‚Äôs talk about what we really came for: the violence! Carnahan Laud set the tone early by absolutely flattening Swamy Ahasuerus. It was a beautiful sight, seeing Swamy head to the healer‚Äôs tent before the game even got warm! The Tamers tried to fight back, with Mitran Mariand managed to injure O'Conner Maighdlin, but the Captains' depth is just too much to handle. Every time a Captain went down, another was there to step on a Tamer‚Äôs throat! 

By the time we hit the second half, the Glowstone Glare was really starting to mess with the visitors. Deach Sharlene, apparently fueled by the confusion, laid out Odericus Juxon with a tackle that sounded like a dry branch snapping! Not to be outdone, the legendary Ladew Evelina‚Äîthat egg-eating machine‚Äîsent Kass Fogel to the dirt. It‚Äôs hard to play ball when you‚Äôre looking for your teeth in the polished stone, isn't it? 

Richia Pazit wasn't just content with scoring; they also decided to personally dismantle Edme Virgil. The Tamers were dropping like flies! It‚Äôs a good thing Carn Tibbetts is a literate healer, because he‚Äôs going to have a lot of paperwork to fill out tonight! The Tamers finally found the end zone late in the game when Alwyn Wandy managed to dunk the ball, but by then, it was like putting a bandage on a decapitation. Too little, too late, you poor, mountain-climbing souls!

Belding Chloe put the final nail in the coffin with a thunderous run into the End Zone, dunking the ball with enough force to vibrate the entire stadium. I‚Äôm sure the folks down in the Market Day Crowd felt that one in their boots! The Captains are playing with a fire that the Haven Lights‚Äîthose shimmering piles of disappointment‚Äîcould never hope to emulate. My favorites, the Ebon Gate Corruptors, are surely watching this and nodding in dark approval!

I have to say, the mountain wind really played a factor today, swirling the ball around like a confused imp. But the Captains handled it like the professionals they are. Even when Caves Cestar was throwing wild passes into the dirt, they recovered with a ferocity that was simply inspiring! They are one win away from moving further into the Winners Bracket, and the Tamers are one loss away from a very sad trip to the Losers Bracket.

Let‚Äôs not overlook the absolute state of Zadoc Wyatan at the end of the match. Behl Berstine decided that the game wasn't quite over until Zadoc was horizontal. That final injury was the cherry on top of a very violent sundae! The Captains are proving that when you play in Confluence, you follow the Guild's rules: win at all costs and leave the field covered in your opponent's lunch!

I‚Äôm looking at the VIP boxes now, and even the 'benevolent' Nikos Thanae looks impressed. He hasn't even shot anyone in the street for at least twenty minutes! That is high praise in this city, folks! If the Tamers want to survive Game 2, they‚Äôre going to need more than sea shanties and hand-carved wooden birds. They‚Äôre going to need a miracle, and miracles are in short supply when Nok the Corrupter is on the mic!

Final score from the Glowstone Terrace: Confluence Captains 4, Oread's Summit Tamers 1! The Captains take the series lead 1-0! Don't go anywhere, because this Best of 3 is just getting warmed up, and I can smell more blood on the horizon! This is Nok the Corrupter, signing off for Tuesday Night Trollball! Stay brutal, Osterra!
